oai_dc:dc.dc:title: John Paul Jones
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lithograph of a painted portrait of John Paul Jones (1747-1792) by Charles Willson Peale
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Military officers; Navies; Military leadership
Jones, John Paul, 1747-1792; United States. Navy--Officers; United States -- History -- Revolution, 1775-1783; United States -- History -- Revolution, 1775-1783 -- American Forces
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: John Paul Jones was a Scottish sailor and naval hero of the Revolutionary War. He is often credited as being the "Father of the United States Navy." Charles Willson Peale painted more than 1000 portraits but was most distinguished for the ones of American Revolutionary War figures.
